page.title: 13Energy sources (Harberton)
page.content: The recent availability of a plentiful wood supply has encouraged the use of woodburning stoves as a source of energy in the home. All homes these days are supplied with mains electricity, but there is no mains gas in the area. Coal, oil, and bottle gas are the other types of energy sources used. Because of the nature of the housing - mostly stone, apart from loft insulation, most modern methods of conserving energy are not practical. As yet solar panels and other alternative sources of power are not in evidence, traditional cosy open fires with perhaps background central heating being more the norm.
